com.password4j

Class Hash

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.password4j.Hash

  • public class Hash
extends Object
    This class contains all the information computed after calculating a cryptographic hash.

    The same HashingFunction used to generate the hash is used to verify the plain password; in addition cryptographic seasoning such as salt and pepper are stored in this object.

    An hash is the product of a one-way function that maps data of arbitrary size to fixed-size values; it is called hashing function (HF). This class represent hashes generated by cryptographic hash function (CHF), where each function has the following properties:

    • it is deterministic, meaning that the same message always results in the same hash
    • it is quick to compute the hash value for any given message
    • it is infeasible to generate a message that yields a given hash value
    • it is infeasible to find two different messages with the same hash value
    • a small change to a message should change the hash value so extensively that the new hash value appears uncorrelated with the old hash value

    A salt is a unique, randomly generated string that is added to each password as part of the hashing process. As the salt is unique for every user, an attacker has to crack hashes one at a time using the respective salt, rather than being able to calculate a hash once and compare it against every stored hash.

    A pepper can be used in additional to salting to provide an additional layer of protection. It is similar to a salt, but has two key differences:

    • The pepper is shared between all stored passwords, rather than being unique like a salt.
    • The pepper is not stored in the database, unlike the salts.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    David Bertoldi
    See Also:
    OWASP Password Storage Cheat Sheet, Cryptographic hash function

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hash

        public Hash(HashingFunction hashingFunction,
            String result,
            String salt)
        Constructs an Hash containing the basic information used and produced by the computational process of hashing a password. Other information, like pepper can be added with setPepper(String).

        This constructor populates the object's attributes.

        Parameters:
        hashingFunction - the cryptographic algorithm used to produce the hash.
        result - the result of the computation of the hash. Notice that the format varies depending on the algorithm.
        salt - the salt used for the computation.
        Since:
        0.1.0
